page.title: 13Social Survey.
page.content: This area has an "easy going" rural atmosphere with no notable violence or trouble.A recent survey of local teenagers showed that most girls smoke under age and most boys drink under age.Both sexes believe in equal opportunities,and would prefer to go to a comprehensive rather than a private school.In this area "classes" range from the working class miners to middle class solicitors and teachers,though class friction is almost non-existent. One of the most notable features of this area is the extremely low ethnic population.This results in a lack of racially based problems. In general the people of the area remain in close family units and have a somewhat insular outlook on life.The older generation tend to be traditional but mix well with the younger generation.
